result.execSummary:
Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr

records.addlTxt:
Jury Trial exhibits from 09/06/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 791
of Representation by Attorney Cerniglia
and Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, received and filed.

Jury in Box. Case recalled. Same appearances. 

At the hour of 4: 14pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of Not Guilty which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, NOT GUILTY of Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, as charged in the Information."

Court discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 4:20pm jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted defense motion and  ordered entry of judgment of acquittal.
Court ordered Exhibit 2 withdrawn. State to contact the Officers to retrieve Exhibit 2.

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr in court.  
Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared for Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Continuation of Jury Trial. Jury in Box. 
Sworn for Defense: Tina A. Direct Examination.  Cross Examination. Re-Direct and Re-Cross Examination. 
Jury out of box for a break. Side bar placed on the record. Case passed. Court back on the record at 11:51am.
Court holds colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to testify or not to testify. 
Court finds defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily AGREED to testify. 
Jurors and parties released for lunch and advised Trial will resume at 1:30pm.

Jury in box at 2:09pm. Case recalled at 2:09pm. Same appearances.
Sworn for Defense: Defendant ( Johnnie McGhee). Direct Examination. Cross Examination. 
Defense rests. State waives Rebuttal.  Jury out of box.
Court held discussion with the parties regarding Jury Instructions and Verdict forms.

Jury in box at 2:53pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.
Court charged the jury. Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  
Jury retired at the hour of 3:33pm  to deliberate in the charge of the Sheriff's Deputy who was duly sworn for that purpose.

Preliminary  Instructions to the Jurors.  Opening statements by state and defense.  
Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Eduardo Garcia
Direct Examination. Exhibits offered and admitted into Evidence: 1A, 1B, 2  
Cross Examination. Side bar. Jury out of box. 
Side bar discussion held between the court and the parties on the record. 
Jury in box. Cross Examination of Officer Garcia continues. Re-Direct and Re-Cross Examination.
Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Jamie Sromalla. 
Direct Examination.  State's Exhibits offered and admitted into Evidence: 1C, 1E, 1F, 1G, 1H, 1I, 1J, 1K
Cross Examination. 
Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Officer Evan Mikulsky. Direct Examination. Cross Examination.
State's Exhibit 3 offered and admitted into Evidence. State rests subject to rebuttal. 
Jury Dismissed for today and instructed to return on 9-7-2022 at 8:30am.
Side bars placed on the record. 
Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence, arguments heard by the State. Defense Motion  Denied.
Court ordered parties  to return on September 7, 2022 at 8:30am/ Branch 19.

Case called on the record at 1:50pm. Same appearances,
Court held colloquy with Juror #5 regarding her concerns. Discussion held with parties outside the presence of Juror #5.
Jury in box at 2:13pm and sworn.
signed  by both parties, received and filed.
received and filed.

Case Recalled at 10:49am. Same appearances.  Jury Panel in box.  
 Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:50 am. Jury out of the box at 11:36am. Jury in box at 11:44am. 

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and not sworn.  Jury list received and filed.

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr in court.  
Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Johnnie Clay McGhee Jr.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin.


Case in court for a Jury Trial ( First Call).  Case remains in trial posture.  Parties are ready to proceed. 
Discussion held regarding Preliminary Jury Instructions. Court is in receipt of a Stipulation  signed by both parties.
Case passed awaiting Jury Panel.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court on Defense Motion. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Defense moves to withdraw his motion. 
Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled September 6, 2022 at 9:00am.
Received and Filed: State's Response to Defense Motion
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court is in receipt of defense motion datred 8-8-2022 and hearing to be scheduled prior to the Jury trial date.
Per email with Defense Counsel and State. Motion Hearing scheduled August 17, 2022 at 3:00pm.
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to Exclude Custodial Statement of defendant.,

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Final Pretrial.State  placed their Offer on the record  and rejected by Defense. Case remains in trial posture.
Court reviewed the State's final pretrial documents. Defense will file his documents by the end of day.
Further discussion held. Defense to file his motion no later than 8-8-2022 by 5pm.
Court ordered case adjourned.  Jury Trial remains calendared for September 6, 2022 at 9:00am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney William R. F. Ackell for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received Discovery and Offer, and is requesting a Final PreTrial and Jury Trial date. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.6.2022

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in court in person with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia who appears by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 05CF2808. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Kanekeo. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-31-2022, Filed.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JLJ (12.19.2006)

Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Johnnie Clay McGhee in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnnie Clay McGhee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  State request to be heard on bail at preliminary hearing.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
